events.message: The policyholder reported a car collision that occurred at a busy intersection on April 28.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to involvement of the insured vehicle.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the vehicle accident claim promptly.
The insured received official notice acknowledging the receipt and initiation of the auto accident claim.
Request sent to the policyholder for police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates.
The insured promptly submitted all required documentation including the police report and repair quotes.
Investigative process began to verify the details of the collision and assess liability factors.
Investigation confirmed the insured vehicle sustained significant damage and the other driver was at fault.
A settlement amount was proposed covering the full repair costs and rental car expenses.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the timely handling of the claim and the fairness of the settlement.
The claim was formally approved by the claims manager after review of all documents and investigation.
Settlement payment was issued to the insuredâ€™s designated account to cover repair and rental expenses.
The claim was officially closed after confirming all payments were received and repairs completed satisfactorily.
All claim files and correspondence were archived for future reference and regulatory compliance purposes.
